result.reason: Right shift key handling is a known Chrome Remote Desktop limitation in scancode translation — mRemoteNG uses standard Windows keyboard input and does not remap modifier keys
result.approach: External tool issue — Chrome Remote Desktop doesn't correctly translate right-shift scancodes. mRemoteNG has no custom keyboard scancode handling that could work around this. Users should report to Google or use an alternative remote access tool.

attempts.raw_output:
This issue is about Chrome Remote Desktop (CRD) not properly handling the right shift key when used to access a machine running mRemoteNG. This is an **external tool limitation** — CRD is known to have issues with modifier key scancodes (particularly right-shift, which uses a different scancode than left-shift). mRemoteNG itself doesn't intercept or remap shift keys at the application level; it relies on standard Windows keyboard input. The RDP keyboard hook in `RdpProtocol.cs` only controls whether keyboard shortcuts are redirected to the remote session, not scancode translation.

This is a Chrome Remote Desktop bug/limitation, not something mRemoteNG can fix.
